intro: Pholidota micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered pholidota, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, typical of the genus Pholidota. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of botanical circles.
